Package de.monoid.web

Welcome to Resty

See:
          Description

Class Summary
AbstractResource Abstract base class for all resource handlers you want to use with Resty.
BinaryResource All purpose resource which is used to access application/octet-stream content or any content in that respect
Content Class to encapsulate content being sent as payload of a POST request.
FormContent Encapsulates form-data sent to web services.
JSONPathQuery  
JSONResource  
PathQuery<T,S> Abstraction for queries into complex datastructures.
Resty Resty is a small, convenient interface to talk to RESTful services.
TextResource This is a text/* representation of a resource.
XMLResource  
XPathQuery  
 

Package de.monoid.web Description

Welcome to Resty

This is the main package for Resty, a simple HTTP/REST client. To get started, check out the Javadoc of the Resty class. Here is a typical usage pattern: 
import static de.monoid.web.Resty.*;
import de.monoid.web.Resty;

...
Resty r = new Resty();
// r.authenticate(...,..,..);

// Look up postal code 66780 in Germany and extract the name of the place from the JSON.
String cityName = r.json("http://ws.geonames.org/postalCodeLookupJSON?postalcode=66780&country=DE").
        get("postalcodes[0].placeName").toString(); 
...
